revised_title: The Discovery of a Perfect Plant in Semine: Henry Baker's Microscopic Findings
tldr: In this article, Henry Baker discovers a perfect plant inside a seed using a microscope. He finds a small plant with two stems and leaves inside the seed's case, providing evidence that seeds contain a complete plant. This discovery supports the idea that seeds have all the necessary components to grow into a mature plant.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
